author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) said on Sunday that there will be a “change in tactics” by the Israeli military in its war in Gaza. “I think Israel’s come to conclude that they can’t achieve a goal of ending the war with Hamas that would be satisfactory to the safety of Israel and that they’re going…
title: Graham says there will be ‘a change in tactics’ by Israeli military in Gaza

author: Robert Stack, opinion contributor
description: The "One Big, Beautiful Bill" has been signed into law, and now incentives must be strengthened to help people with disabilities move to, remain in, and thrive within their communities, as community-based programs are far more effective and less expensive than large congregate care.
title: This can be a ‘big, beautiful’ win for Americans with disabilities

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump and President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen announced a trade deal on Sunday, setting tariffs at 15 percent for European goods, including automobiles. The European Union will purchase $750 billion worth of energy from the U.S. as part of the deal, Trump announced, and agreed to invest in the U.S.…
title: Trump, EU’s von der Leyen strike trade deal for 15 percent tariffs

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Medicaid cuts under President Trump’s sweeping tax and spending package will harm family caregivers, experts warn, by reducing access to health care for themselves and the people they care for, which could then lead to more caregiving responsibilities.   The Congressional Budget Office estimates the package will reduce Medicaid spending by roughly $911 billion over the next…
title: Medicaid changes will hurt family caregivers, experts warn

author: Tara Suter
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) on Sunday called an effort from Reps. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) and Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) on files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein “reckless” as controversy over the disgraced financier roils Washington. “House Republicans insist upon the release of all credible evidence and information related to Epstein in any way,”…
title: Johnson calls Massie, Khanna Epstein files effort ‘reckless’

author: Rachel Scully
description: Gaza humanitarian director for Save the Children Rachael Cumming said that the situation for people in Gaza is “catastrophic,” emphasizing that children “are literally starving.” “The situation in Gaza is catastrophic for children and increasingly now for adults. There is no food available in the market. Children are literally starving,” she told Jonathan Karl during…
title: Non-profit director in Gaza: ‘Children are literally starving’

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Coca-Cola is going to offer a cane sugar version of its signature beverage, rather than one sweetened with corn syrup.   Major segments of the food industry, including General Mills and Heinz, have pledged to remove certain colored dyes from their products.   The fast-food chain Steak ‘n Shake is making french fries in beef tallow…
title: Coke with cane sugar may not be that big of a MAHA victory

author: Fred Roeder, opinion contributor
description: Powerful new medications such as Ozempic and Mounjaro, known as GLP-1 drugs are helping to win the war against obesity in America. But just as these drugs are changing lives, a dangerous shadow market is growing alongside them.
title: The FDA must crack down on dangerous knockoff weight-loss drugs

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump is using his influence to help Republicans avoid messy primary fights as the party prepares for the midterms.  Trump recently waded into both Michigan’s Senate race and the New York gubernatorial contest in an effort to convince notable candidates — Rep. Bill Huizenga (R) and Rep. Mike Lawler (R), respectively — to opt…
title: Trump this time is trying to help GOP avoid messy primary fights

author: Rachel Scully
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) called the images of people, including children, starving in Gaza “disturbing and heartbreaking,” but insisted that Hamas “has stolen the food,” despite reports from the Israeli military that there is no proof that the Palestinian militant group had systematically stolen aid. Johnson, during an interview on NBC’s “Meet the Press,”…
title: Johnson on Gaza hunger crisis: ‘Hamas has stolen the food‘

author: The Associated Press
description: The 42-year-old suspect allegedly used a folding knife to stab 11 people at random, authorities said.
title: Man accused of stabbing 11 at Michigan Walmart was stopped by crowd: witness

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) on Sunday said that the current controversy over convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is “going to hurt Republicans in the midterms.” “This is going to hurt Republicans in the midterms, the voters will be apathetic if we don’t hold the rich and powerful accountable,” Massie told NBC News’s Kristen Welker on…
title: Massie says Epstein controversy ‘going to hurt Republicans in the midterms’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump on Saturday doubled down on his accusations that former Vice President Harris paid celebrities to endorse her during the 2024 presidential election.  The president, echoing previous claims that Harris paid Beyoncé, Oprah and Al Sharpton to support her White House bid throughout the campaign trail, said Harris and the celebrities involved should be…
title: Trump doubles down on claims Harris paid for endorsements, says she should be ‘prosecuted’

author: The Associated Press
description: BOSTON (AP) — Astronomer — the company whose CEO resigned after being caught on a KissCam at a Coldplay rock concert embracing a woman who was not his wife — is trying to move on from the drama with someone who knows the band pretty well. Actress Gwyneth Paltrow, who was married to Coldplay’s frontman Chris Martin…
title: Company involved in Coldplay KissCam drama hires Gwyneth Paltrow as spokesperson

author: The Associated Press
description: Multiple people were stabbed at a Walmart in Traverse City, and a suspect was in custody, authorities said Saturday.
title: At least 11 people stabbed at a Walmart in Michigan, and a suspect is in custody

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Political analyst Maggie Haberman on Friday evaluated the potential impact of President Trump possibly pardoning convicted sex offender Ghislaine Maxwell after she cooperated with the Justice Department (DOJ) during two days of interviews.  “It’s quite a line to walk,” Haberman said during an appearance on CNN’s “The Source with Kaitlan Collins.”  “What I think you’re…
title: Haberman: Trump potential pardon of Maxwell amid Epstein chaos ‘quite a line to walk’
